sentences.english: It is an inevitable choice to develop the strategy of famous brand for an enterprise in the keen market competitions.
sentences.chinese: 实施名牌战略是企业在激烈的市场竞争中的必然选择。

sentences.english: But the dollar's unity or reunification of the rentier war is inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 但是美元统一或食利者的统一战争，是必然出现。

sentences.english: Thou annointest my day with pep; my mug runneth over.
sentences.chinese: 你宣告了我充沛的一天，一切的疲惫必然消失不见。

sentences.english: Oil-free compressors of course, are the logical choice for instrument-air supplies.
sentences.chinese: 自然，无油压缩机必然被选择为仪用空气供给者。

sentences.english: A corollary of that is I hate flag waving.
sentences.chinese: 以上导致的必然结果是，我讨厌国旗挥舞。

sentences.english: There is inevitable connection between the Manchu culture and the source of Jin culture.
sentences.chinese: 满族文化和金源文化之间存在着必然的关联。

sentences.english: If you serve like Jesus, you can expect to be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 假若你像耶稣那样地服事，必然会受到批评。

sentences.english: The last is centralization, which is a general trend of English development.
sentences.chinese: 五是一元化，这将是英语发展的必然结果。

sentences.english: This will disappoint Pan Qinglin, a member of the consultative committee that advises China's government.
sentences.chinese: 这必然会使政协委员潘庆林感到失望。

sentences.english: Constructing service chain is a necessity for the development of the Chinese retailing industry.
sentences.chinese: 构建服务链战略是中国零售业发展的必然选择。

sentences.english: Therefore, the non-hegemony is the inevitable choice of China for the…
sentences.chinese: 从四个方面来看，不称霸是中国必然的选择。

sentences.english: These commence and criticism are inevitable and not at all surprizing.
sentences.chinese: 这些评论和批评是必然的，并不令人感到奇怪。

sentences.english: Carnap tried to define causality from the angle of semantics.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔纳普试图从语义学角度来定义因果必然性。

sentences.english: The air must push onto the balloon.
That would "have its impact on China as well, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，这必然会对中国经济发生冲击。

sentences.english: These two concepts are bound to the anti-title.
sentences.chinese: 这两个概念处于必然的反题。

definition: to be bound to/to be sure to
to be certain/to be positive/assuredly/definitely/to give recognition/to affirm/affirmative (answer)
to foreordain/to be bound to/to be destined to/to be doomed to/inevitably
